chargeHist.descr: Homicide by Negligent Handling of Dangerous Weapon/Explosive

result.execSummary:
The defendant Derrick Dwight Ellis was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case. One or more other charges in this case were dismissed. The dismissed charges were not proven and have no legal effect. Derrick Dwight Ellis is presumed innocent of the dismissed charges.

  • Derrick Dwight Ellis was found guilty of Possession Of A Firearm By Outstate Felon, a class G felony, Wisconsin Statutes 941.29(1m)(b).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

records.addlTxt:
Defendant Derrick Dwight Ellis in court with Attorney Christopher J. Cherella.  Defendant Derrick Dwight Ellis in custody.  Michael Jerome Lonski appeared for the State of Wisconsin. All parties appear in person.
Parties stipulate that during the plea hearing of April 27 Count 2 was dismissed outright; not dismissed and read-in.  Court orders the record be corrected.

Sentencing proceeds.  State has complied with victim notification.  Statements by the State, defense counsel and defendant. 

-  Court sets Restitution at $0   (zero) 

As to Count  1:
COURT ORDERS defendant to serve a term in the Wisconsin State Prison system - TOTAL LENGTH OF SENTENCE -  10   years with  192  days credit -  INITIAL TERM OF CONFINEMENT -  5  years  -  EXTENDED SUPERVISION -  5  years.  
Court STAYS the sentence and places the defendant on probation for a period of  4  years.

Court finds defendant is not eligible for the Challenge Incarceration Program and is not eligible for the Substance Abuse Program.

CONDITIONS OF PROBATION:
-  Serve 12 months in the House of Correction.  Defense counsel request for Huber denied by the Court.  Condition time to be straight time; good time credit may be earned.
-  Obtain GED/HSD/HSED
-  Seek/Maintain employment (full-time if possible)
-  No Weapons
-  Pay the costs, fees, assessments and surcharges during the term of probation.  Failure to pay will result in a civil judgment.

CONDITIONS OF EXTENDED SUPERVISION:
-  Obtain GED/HSD/HSED
-  Seek/Maintain employment (full-time if possible)
-  No Weapons
-  Pay the costs, fees, assessments and surcharges during the term of extended supervision.  Failure to pay will result in a civil judgment.

COURT ORDERS:
-  defendant to provide a biological specimen for DNA analysis and pay the surcharge (if not already done so) during the term of probation or extended supervision.  Failure to pay will result in a civil judgment.
if confinement is served - DOC to collect monetary sums/amounts at a rate (to be determined by DOC) of prison funds.

Appeal rights given.
Sentencing hearing scheduled for July 29, 2022 at 01:30 pm.

Defendant Derrick Dwight Ellis not in court.  Michael Jerome Lonski appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
Atty. C. Cherella in contact with the court via electronic mail.
Court is in trial on an unrelated case.  Defense counsel advised that family members would be traveling from another state for the hearing on June 16, 2022.
As it is unlikely the case can proceed to sentencing on June 16, 2022 Judge approved adjournment of the hearing.

Case is rescheduled for sentencing on July 29, 2022 in Branch 28.
Parties in contact with the deputy clerk via electronic mail.

VIS_Brazell_2022CF00168_22CF000051.pdf, Filed.

For reasons stated on the record, the Court DENIES defense motion for bail reduction.  Defense requests sentencing hearing date. All previously ordered conditions of bail remain. Case remains calendared in Branch 25.

Defendant Derrick Dwight Ellis in court with attorney Christopher J. Cherella.  Defendant Derrick Dwight Ellis in custody.  Michael Jerome Lonski appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
Document filed by the defense orderd sealed by the court.   

Defendant was advised of constitutional rights and maximum penalties, waived all rights, and plead GUILTY AS TO COUNT 1.  Defendant examined as to the plea.  Plea Questionnaire/Waiver of Rights, Addendum, and Jury Instructions received and filed.  Stipulation by parties to the Criminal Complaint as a factual basis to sustain the plea.  Court found the defendant guilty.  Judgment of conviction entered.
  
Court advised defendant that as a convicted felon he may never possess any gun or other firearms, ammunition, or body armor. 
Court advised defendant that his voting rights are suspended, and may not vote in any election until his civil rights are restored.    
Court advised that the defendant will have to provide a DNA sample, to the Wisconsin State Crime Laboratory for DNA testing and pay a DNA surcharge.

Pursuant to plea negotiations and on motion of the State, Court ordered COUNT 2 dismissed and read-in to case for the purpose of sentencing.  Sentencing hearing scheduled for June 16, 2022 at 01:30 pm.

Defendant Derrick Dwight Ellis in court with attorney Christopher J. Cherella.  Defendant Derrick Dwight Ellis in custody.  Michael Jerome Lonski appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  
Original Information filed.  Copy given to defense counsel who waived reading.  Defendant pled not guilty.  Plea hearing scheduled for April 27, 2022 at 02:00 pm.
Due to Courthouse closure, the arraignment scheduled for 02-22-2022 is rescheduled.  Arraignment scheduled for March 3, 2022 at 01:30 pm.
The Arraignment scheduled for 02-22-2022 at 1:30pm will be held on 02-22-2022 at 1:15pm.

Defendant Derrick Dwight Ellis in court with attorney Christopher J. Cherella both by video.  Defendant Derrick Dwight Ellis in custody.  Michael Jerome Lonski appeared for the State of Wisconsin. 
Preliminary hearing proceeded. Due to the nature of Count 2, this case is reassigned to Br. 25. Sworn for the State: Det. Brian Maciejewski - MPD   State rests.  Defense rests.  Defense motion to dismiss argued and denied. Court found probable cause and bound defendant over for trial.  Original information received and filed.  Case is adjourned for Arraignment to Branch 25.  Arraignment scheduled for February 22, 2022 at 01:30 pm.

Court ordered defendant TURNED OVER TO Justice Point for SUPERVISION Level 5.
No possession of dangerous weapons or firearms.

Defendant Derrick Dwight Ellis in court with attorney Christopher J. Cherella as friend of court for Initial Appearance.  Defendant Derrick Dwight Ellis in custody.  Matthew Zisi appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Derrick Dwight Ellis appeared by video means with Attorney.  Defendant is advised this case is assigned to Judge Feiss, Branch 46.  AS TO COUNT 1:  Motion to dismiss for lack of evidence to support charge by defense argued and DENIED by the Court.   Defendant given a copy of the complaint and advised of maximum penalties, right to counsel and right to a preliminary hearing.  Court reviewed the complaint and found probable cause to hold the defendant for further proceedings.  DEFENDANT IS INDIGENT AND PUBLIC DEFENDER WILL PROVIDE COUNSEL.  Commissioner advised DNA sample has NOT been obtained from the Defendant.  Court ordered the Milwaukee County Sheriff's Department to obtain DNA sample from the Defendant.  Court advised Defendant he may qualify to have the DNA sample data expunged if he meets the conditions under Wisconsin Statutes Section 165.77(4).
